summary: This document is an email containing a series of text message exchanges from July and August 2019. The messages discuss scheduling a call or meeting and reveal that a person involved in the case is being contacted by a journalist and is concerned about their name being public.

events.title: Scheduled Call
events.description: A call is scheduled for 1pm. Details including a phone number and code are shared.

events.title: Journalist Contact
events.description: An individual reports that a journalist has knocked on their door three times in one day. They express being upset and ask if their name is public in the case, indicating a desire to discuss the situation.

events.title: Follow-up Coordination
events.description: A follow-up conversation is coordinated, with a time set for 2pm using a conference room and phone.

keyFacts: A person involved in the Epstein case was directly contacted by a journalist at their home on August 13, 2019.
The contacted person expressed significant concern about whether their name was publicly known in the case.
The messages show coordination for confidential conversations, using specific phone numbers and participant codes.
The document is an email from December 2019 forwarding screenshots of text messages from mid-2019.
Key individuals in the text messages are redacted, preventing their identification.
